text: Abraham Maslow (April 1, 1908 – June 8, 1970) was an American psychologist. He is considered by other psychologists to be one of the most important psychologists of the 20th century.[Haggloom, S. J., Warnick, R, Warnick, J., Jones, V. K., Yarbough, G.L., Russel, T. M. 2002 The 100 most eminent psychologists of the 20th century. Review of General Psychology, 6, 139–152] He was ranked 10th among psychologists nominated for being well-known or influential. He is known for creating Maslow's hierarchy of needs. Maslow died of a heart attack. ==References== Category:1908 births Category:1970 deaths Category:American atheists Category:American psychologists Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Jewish American writers Category:Writers from Brooklyn Category:University of Wisconsin–Madison alumni
title: Abraham Maslow
